title: Copa Centro-Oeste
text:
Copa Centro-Oeste () was a Brazilian <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> competition contested between <a href="Center-West%20Region%2C%20Brazil">Center-West region</a> teams and teams from the <a href="Southeast%20Region%2C%20Brazil">Southeastern</a> State <a href="Esp%C3%ADrito%20Santo">Espírito Santo</a>. For one edition, it was also contested by teams from <a href="Minas%20Gerais">Minas Gerais</a>. 
<a href="Minas%20Gerais">Minas Gerais</a> state clubs only competed in the first Copa Centro-Oeste edition, in 1999, joining the new <a href="Copa%20Sul-Minas">Copa Sul-Minas</a> in 2000. <a href="Cruzeiro%20Esporte%20Clube">Cruzeiro</a>, from Minas Gerais, won the Cup and was the only non-Central Western team to reach the finals in the four editions of the tourney.
From 2000 to 2002, the Copa Centro-Oeste champions granted qualification to the <a href="Copa%20dos%20Campe%C3%B5es">Copa dos Campeões</a>.
Similar competitions.
The Copa Brasil Central was held in 1967, while the Torneio Centro-Oeste was held in 1976, 1981 and in 1984. The 1976 edition was organized by the <a href="Brazilian%20Football%20Confederation">CBD</a>.
